snippet: In what is expected to be his final year in office, President Hamid Karzai is intensifying his criticism of his American allies at a critical moment in their Afghan endgame.
abstract: News analysis; Afghan President Hamid Karzai, in what is expected to be his final year in office, is taking a gamble by intensifying his criticism of his American allies at a critical moment in their Afghan military endgame, risking their support for him in order to save himself politically; he is seen as desperately trying to shake his widely held image as an American lackey by appealing to nationalist sentiments and invoking Afghanistan's sovereignty.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan; Sangar Rahimi from Kabul; and Farooq Jan Mangal from Khost, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: In what is expected to be his final year in office, President Hamid Karzai is intensifying his criticism of his American allies at a critical moment in their Afghan endgame.
